articles.author: Annabel Brady-Brown
articles.title: Lapsis spins sci-fi satire from the gig economy, as a cable guy's quick-cash dream turns to nightmare - ABC News
articles.description: In Lapsis, a middle-aged man swaps his dead-end job for the promise of quick cash and a better view, laying fibre optic cable in the American wilds. Of course, there's a catch.
articles.content: Dreams of escaping the rat race get a witty, sci-fi spin in Lapsis, a film righteously attuned to the creeping horror felt by those trapped in the gig economy, and gallantly carried by its unexpected… [+5779 chars]

articles.description: American-born Fatima Altakrouri says a Southwest attendant said she "couldn’t speak English and would bring the whole plane down in an emergency”.
articles.content:
